mskcc.oncotree 0.1.0

Reads ontology_mappings.txt from OncoTree's GitHub repository

Source: R/read_ontology_mappings.R
read_ontology_mappings.Rd

Reads `ontology_mappings.txt` from OncoTree's GitHub repository and returns its contents as a tibble.

Usage

read_ontology_mappings(
  url = ontology_mapping_url(),
  fix_names = TRUE,
  list_columns = TRUE
)

Arguments

url

URL of `ontology_mappings.txt`.

fix_names

Whether to convert column names to lowercase, snakecase.

list_columns

Whether to return multi-value variables as list-columns.

Value

A [tibble][tibble::tibble-package] of six variables:

`oncotree_code`

OncoTree code.

`nci_code`

National Cancer Institute (NCI) Thesaurus code.

`umls_code`

Uniﬁed Medical Language System (UMLS) code.

`icdo_topography_code`

ICD-O topography code.

`icdo_morphology_code`

ICD-O morphology code.

`hemeonc_code`

HemeOnc code.

Examples

# Import ontology_mappings.txt as tibble
read_ontology_mappings()
#> # A tibble: 852 × 6
#>    oncotree_code nci_code  umls_code icdo_topography_code icdo_morphology_code
#>    <chr>         <list>    <list>    <chr>                <chr>               
#>  1 MMB           <chr [1]> <chr [1]> NA                   NA                  
#>  2 AIS           <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C80.9                8140/2              
#>  3 AASTR         <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C72.9                9401/3              
#>  4 FL            <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C42.4                9690/3              
#>  5 VIMT          <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C57.9                9080/3              
#>  6 KIDNEY        <chr [1]> <chr [1]> NA                   NA                  
#>  7 MDEP          <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C72.9                9501/3              
#>  8 PAOS          <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C41.9                9192/3              
#>  9 PRSCC         <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C61.9                8002/3              
#> 10 DSTAD         <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C16.9                8145/3              
#> # … with 842 more rows, and 1 more variable: hemeonc_code <chr>

# Do not convert column names, i.e. keep them as originally in the file
read_ontology_mappings(fix_names = FALSE)
#> # A tibble: 852 × 6
#>    ONCOTREE_CODE NCIT_CODE UMLS_CODE ICDO_TOPOGRAPHY_CODE ICDO_MORPHOLOGY_CODE
#>    <chr>         <list>    <list>    <chr>                <chr>               
#>  1 MMB           <chr [1]> <chr [1]> NA                   NA                  
#>  2 AIS           <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C80.9                8140/2              
#>  3 AASTR         <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C72.9                9401/3              
#>  4 FL            <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C42.4                9690/3              
#>  5 VIMT          <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C57.9                9080/3              
#>  6 KIDNEY        <chr [1]> <chr [1]> NA                   NA                  
#>  7 MDEP          <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C72.9                9501/3              
#>  8 PAOS          <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C41.9                9192/3              
#>  9 PRSCC         <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C61.9                8002/3              
#> 10 DSTAD         <chr [1]> <chr [1]> C16.9                8145/3              
#> # … with 842 more rows, and 1 more variable: HEMEONC_CODE <chr>

# Keep multi-value columns as originally, i.e. as comma-separated values
read_ontology_mappings(list_columns = FALSE)
#> # A tibble: 852 × 6
#>    oncotree_code nci_code umls_code icdo_topography_code icdo_morphology_code
#>    <chr>         <chr>    <chr>     <chr>                <chr>               
#>  1 MMB           C3706    C0205833  NA                   NA                  
#>  2 AIS           C4123    C0334276  C80.9                8140/2              
#>  3 AASTR         C9477    C0334579  C72.9                9401/3              
#>  4 FL            C3209    C0024301  C42.4                9690/3              
#>  5 VIMT          C4286    C0334520  C57.9                9080/3              
#>  6 KIDNEY        C12415   C0022646  NA                   NA                  
#>  7 MDEP          C4327    C0334596  C72.9                9501/3              
#>  8 PAOS          C8969    C0206642  C41.9                9192/3              
#>  9 PRSCC         C6766    C1300585  C61.9                8002/3              
#> 10 DSTAD         C9159    C0279635  C16.9                8145/3              
#> # … with 842 more rows, and 1 more variable: hemeonc_code <chr>
